docs.text: `the bachelor' is one of the best terrible movies you will ever see .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wading through this gooey , detestable sludge is quite the chore for even a dedicated romantic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: those hoping to find some genuine charm and feeling behind this chris o'donnell vehicle should wander elsewhere ; `the bachelor' is a painfully clumsy mess strung together with a few brief moments of surprising poignancy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: awaiting these moments by enduring the rest of the film is certainly not worth your time or money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although he has not quite evolved out of the stereotypical pretty-boy cocoon , chris o'donnell has an effortless charm as an actor .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most will recognize him as the high-flying robin from the two latest `batman' films , but other abilities are evident behind his boyish smile .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: can o'donnell carry the weight of a film on his shoulders ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: perhaps , if he found the proper vehicle . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but `the bachelor' falls far short of the requirements .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actor just can't register with such a pathetic screenplay as the guiding light to success .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a few instances of adorable humor aside , it becomes apparent that no one could save the festering mess that is `the bachelor' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: o'donnell plays jimmie , a hopeless romantic in his late twenties who's progressing in a serious relationship with anne ( renee zellweger ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jimmie takes anne out for dinner to the restaurant specifically used for proposals , and attempts to ask for her hand in marriage .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the problem is that his proposal sucks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: big time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you can tell things aren't going pleasantly , because jimmie gets the infamous ? deer-in-the-headlights' look when anne questions his approach .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and then , the plot ( along with the stupidity of the movie ) thickens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jimmie's grandfather ( peter ustinov ) dies suddenly , leaving a video will behind for his grandson ( who also happens to be his only living relative ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everybody is speechless when grandpa declares that he is passing down an inheritance in the amount of 100 million dollars to jimmie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , there's a catch : he must get married before his 30th birthday , stay joined with his bride for an entire decade , and produce healthy children within the first five years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the bad news is that jimmie's birthday is the following day .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with anne out of town , he must find a willing bride to share his riches with . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and within a very limited time frame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are certainly a few worthwhile aspects of `the bachelor' .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for one , the movie's approach is interesting and not dripping with clich ? .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: another is the colorful cast .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: o'donnell and zellweger are cute together , and the supporting cast tries relentlessly to rescue the film from drowning in it's own mediocrity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ustinov is enjoyable as the cranky grandfather figure , and james cromwell is sincere and effective as a wise priest dragged through jimmie's marital adventures .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and now the cons : the approach may be interesting , but in trying an old-fashioned method , director gary sinyor gives the film a synthetic feel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the characters are drawn with obvious , broad strokes , and the plot is bogged down with everything humanly imaginable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yes , `the bachelor' is far more frustrating than cute .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the screenplay is lamely written , and the subject matter poorly conceived .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the considerable charm of the two leads is thoughtlessly wasted , along with whatever promise the film initially contained .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: potential goes out the window early to suit sinyor's `colorful' approach , but not a minute of this hapless drivel seems accustomed to the director's wishes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: `the bachelor' becomes lost without a homing beacon to save it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you've seen the tv spots , haven't you ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: o'donnell is madly rushing down a deserted street and the caption reads `what is this man running from ? '
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in actuality , he's fleeing from thousands of angry brides who want to marry him and inherit his fortune ( it's one of the few enjoyable sequences in the film ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after seeing the movie , i believe that the approaching horde could be something else .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: o'donnell could be running from his angry fans , who have just endured `the bachelor' , and are hunting him down for revenge .
docs.label: negative
